resources.string: Your feedback helps us to improve your calling experience.
Alerts are not available. Only %1$s can set Alerts.

To set up Alexa Hands-Free, download the Alexa app.
To set up Alexa Hands-Free, enable your Alexa app.
To set up Alexa Hands-Free, sign in to your Alexa app.
To set up Alexa Hands-Free, update your Alexa app.
Unable to launch advanced wifi settings.
Move to select and pinch to resize. The cropped image will be used on your device home screen.
Unable to load the selected photo.
Pinch to resize and reposition. The cropped image will be used as the background on your Clock and Home screens. Your device will automatically switch to a Personal Photo Theme.
By uploading a background image you agree to the Amazon Drive and Prime Photos <font color=#0070BA>Terms of Use</font> and acknowledge that a copy of the image will be saved in Prime Photos.
By uploading a background image, you agree that the image will be accessed and temporarily stored in the cloud as part of the upload process.
Allow %1$s to recognize when you say “Alexa”.
Get Alexa responses on your lock screen when your phone is locked.

“Respond while locked” uses your phone’s voice recognition feature to identify you. This is not a secure feature. A person with a similar voice or recording of your voice could activate Alexa responses on this phone.
Get Alexa responses on your lock screen even when your phone is locked.
Ask Alexa for music, weather, and more on your phone even when the Alexa app isn’t open.
Cards show up here the more you use Alexa.

To get started, go to device settings, select this Fire tablet, tap Communications and enable Announcements.

All calls to phone numbers will use Alexa free calling. These calls require cellular data or Wi-Fi.
To call, Drop In, and message, set up Alexa Communication
Call %1$s using your phone\'s dialer or your preferred calling app
Communications is not enabled for this device. Go to settings in Alexa Devices to turn on.
Ask %1$s to tap the link you shared. It will open a web browser to a screen called \"Set up Alexa Communication.\"
Need to resend the setup link?
If needed, have them sign into their Amazon account. Then, ask them to tap on their name on the profile screen.
Have them enter their mobile phone number into the box on the \"Add your mobile number\" screen. Then, tap \"Next.\"
A text message with a verification code will be sent to them. Have them copy or write it down.
Ask them to paste the code into the white box labeled \"Enter OTP\", then, tap \"Next.\"
Set up Alexa Communication to enable Emergency contact
Share setup link with %1$s. It will open a web browser to a screen called \"Set up Alexa Communication\".
If you think they will need help with setup, you can walk them through the process.
You can now talk to Alexa and your voice will be recognized.
Sorry, something went wrong. Please try again later.
You have no contacts outside of your household to block
Are you sure you want to block %1$s? This will prevent anybody in this contact\'s household from contacting you and others in your household using Alexa calling or messaging.
Are you sure you want to unblock %1$s? This will allow anybody in this contact\'s household to contact you and others in your household using Alexa calling or messaging.

Contacts in this section may not have phonetic information. Phonetic information helps Alexa understand contacts\' names.
Alexa uses your phone or tablet\'s address book to find people you know.

Message and call your contacts with Alexa
Give Alexa permission to access your contacts by tapping on Contacts for the Alexa App in your device settings.
Now you can communicate with your <link>friends and family</link>.
“Alexa, make a call”\n“Alexa, send a message”\n“Alexa, play my messages”
Make an audio call to your contacts
Send a message to your contacts
Are you sure you want to remove these conversations? These conversations will no longer show in your message history.
Are you sure you want to remove this conversation? This conversation will no longer show in your message history.
You are not connected to the internet. Please connect to the internet and try again.
An error occurred and your voice profile was not deleted. Please restart your device and try again.
Your voice training will be permanently deleted and Alexa Hands-Free will be turned off. If in the future you would like Alexa to respond to your voice, turn on Hands-Free and retrain your voice.
A voice profile enables Alexa to learn your voice, call you by name, and provide enhanced personalization.
Navigate to Bluetooth settings and allow new connections to set up your device.
The Alexa app uses Bluetooth to discover and connect to devices, for device setup, and to detect when you are near supported devices.
For the best experience, please turn on location services on your mobile phone.
Enable Notifications in your system settings to allow Alexa to show notifications

Something went wrong and screen sharing ended. You are no longer sharing your screen.
Screen sharing ended due to inactivity. You are no longer sharing your screen.
Customer Service wants to resume screen sharing with you.
We couldn\'t send the announcement, try again later

Distracted driving can lead to serious fatal and injury accident or property damage accident. To continue operation, first stop in a safe place. Pay close attention to road condition while driving. Do not prioritize operation of the device while driving. You are solely responsible for safe driving and compliance with laws and regulations regarding the use of electronic devices while driving. Keep your eyes on road signs, regulations, and road condition. Gaze at the equipment or operate the equipment by hand while driving may violate the Road Traffic Act. For more safety information, go to the Alexa app and select \"Help and Feedback\" then \"Terms etc.\"
Warning! Do not operate the device by hand while driving.

Exit Auto mode and see your lock\'s settings page to enable Unlock by App to use while driving.

Interacting with your Alexa app while driving can be dangerous and result in serious injury, death or property damage. Please park your car in a safe location before continuing.

%1$s has disabled Drop In with you. You will not be able to Drop In on their devices from Alexa Together or by voice unless they allow Drop In with you.
%1$s has allowed Drop In with you. You will be able to Drop In on their devices from Alexa Together and by voice.
Learn how %1$s can allow Drop In with you, so you can Drop In on their devices.
Manage your Drop In settings for %1$s.

Enable Drop In

To get started, go to device settings, select the device you want to enable, tap Communications, then set permissions.
Drop In lets household members and contacts instantly connect to your Echo devices.\n

Enable Drop In

To get started, go to My Profile and tap to Allow Drop In.

When Drop In is enabled, this contact and their household members can instantly connect to your Echo devices for a video or voice conversation. Interactions with Alexa, and motion sensors on Echo Show, will be used to show a recently active indicator that lets them know whether you’re available.

When Drop In is enabled, you and your household members can instantly connect to your Echo devices for a video or voice conversation. Interactions with Alexa, and motion sensors on Echo Show, will be used to show a recently active indicator that lets household members know whether you’re available.
Drop In uses Alexa interactions and Echo Show’s motion sensors to let household members know whether you’re recently active. Learn more in Help & Feedback.
Instantly connect to your Echo for a chat by saying “Alexa, Drop In”.
You can manage Drop In settings on your contact card.
Contacts can Drop In on my Echo Devices
To call and message friends and family with Alexa and your existing phone service, the Alexa app needs permission to:
• Make, receive, and manage phone calls
• Send, receive, and read SMS messages
• Check the status of your connected phone, including current cellular network information, and the status of any ongoing calls
• Transfer active calls to your mobile phone
Server is experiencing problems. Please try again later.
To use Effects disable Call Captions.
To use Effects disable Real Time Text.
Sorry, effects are not available right now.

Question 1) 
 Tell us what happened. 
 Please be as specific as possible so we can better diagnose your issue.

 Question 2) 
 Is this a recurring problem?

 Question 3) 
 What WiFi network or Cell Network you are on? (e.g., T-Mobile, Guest at Amazon)
Set up Alexa Communication to contact %1$s on their Alexa devices.
%1$s must set up Alexa Communication before adding an emergency contact.
Alexa Communication is not set up on your account. You must set it up before adding an emergency contact.
Alexa will attempt to contact this number when your loved one asks Alexa to call for help.
If you ask Alexa for help, Alexa will attempt to call and message the emergency contact.
You are not the emergency contact. You will still receive an Alexa app notification in an emergency.
You are not the emergency contact. Enable Alexa app notifications to be notified if %1$s asks for help.
You can check in with %1$s now through their Alexa device. However, if Urgent Response tries to call back they will not be able to connect.
%1$s is no longer connected to Urgent Response.
%1$s made a call to Urgent Response from %2$s.
You will be notified when the call is completed.
Please keep in mind that %1$s will be connected through an Alexa device. If you try to Drop In or call their Alexa device while %1$s is on a call with Urgent Response, you will not be connected.
%1$s must set up Alexa Communications before adding an emergency contact or using the Urgent Response.
Set up Alexa Communications to add an emergency contact and use the Urgent Response.

When recognized, Alexa will provide your kid with kid-friendly responses. Voice recognition is not perfect. Alexa may mistake your child for another speaker. Voice profiles for children are supported only on Echo devices, like Echo and Echo Show, and are not supported on Fire TV and other Alexa built-in devices.\n%1$s
By tapping “Continue”, you agree to the %1$s and authorize Amazon to create your kid\'s voice. Their voice will be stored in the cloud.

Android Smart Lock can keep your phone unlocked when it’s near home, work, or connected to your car, allowing easier interaction with Alexa. To use:\n
Pick a trusted place to keep your phone unlocked, such as home or work\n
Pick a trusted device, such as your car, to keep your phone unlocked when it’s connected to your device

To use Read Together, both you and your contact must enable Enhanced Features. To do this, go to Settings > Communications > Enhanced Features in the Alexa App. Read Together will work from your next call.

To teach Alexa to recognize your voice update your privacy settings in the Alexa app, or amazon.com/alexaprivacysettings to anything but “Don\'t save recordings”. This allows Alexa to save your voice recordings when you create a voice profile. Your voice will be stored in the cloud until you delete it.

To change your settings: 
 1. Go to settings and tap “Alexa Privacy” 
 2. Tap “Manage Your Alexa Data” 
 3. Choose any option besides “Don't save recordings” 
 4. Return to the Alexa App 
 * This change may take up to 24 hours to update.
You\'ll need to update your privacy settings
